title.narrative: DIF4 DRA - 121 platform: Upskilling and Upscaling Cash and Voucher Assistance

description.narrative: ZOA applies as a co-applicant to the 121 initiative scaling up innovation to improve coordinated cash & voucher assistance. ZOA is expected to contribute to 2 different engagements: the development of a cash wizard to support field staff to improve the quality of all cash programs, and the implementation of the 'full package' in one of the countries using 121 software. Ethiopia (Addis Abeba programme) is selected as country of implementation.

title.narrative: Final Narrative Report
1. Humanitarian organizations understand their key challenges in setting up and scaling safe, fast and fair emergency cash programs and the added value that 121 solutions can bring

description.narrative: 1 - Humanitarian organizations understand their key challenges in setting up and scaling safe, fast and fair emergency cash programs and the added value that 121 solutions can bring

title.narrative: 1 - Number of organisations with increased insights about setting up and scaling safe, fast and fair emergency cash programs and the added value of 121 solutions

comment.narrative: ZOA successfully completed the different activities with various staff from different countries, and implemented a conditional cash project in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, using the 121 solution. This increased insights and 121 solution was an added value.

title.narrative: 1.1 Humanitarian organisations pacticipated in human centred design processes to gain insights about challenges, barriers and solutions to scale cash programming

description.narrative: 1.1 - Humanitarian organisations pacticipated in human centred design processes to gain insights about challenges, barriers and solutions to scale cash programming

title.narrative: 1.1 - Number of DRA members and their local partners that participated in human centered design processes
1.2 Case studies produced that describe common challenges and solutions in cash in emergency programs

description.narrative: 1.2 - Case studies produced that describe common challenges and solutions in cash in emergency programs

title.narrative: 1.2 - Number of case studies produced and shared within the humanitarian sector

comment.narrative: ZOA developed 1 case study on the use of 121 products in Ethiopia project, and how it improved cash IM processes was developed by external consultant.

title.narrative: 1.3 Context and organisational specific roadmaps developed to tackle identified obstacles through implementation of 121 products, cash information management and process optimalisation steps

description.narrative: 1.3 - Context and organisational specific roadmaps developed to tackle identified obstacles through implementation of 121 products, cash information management and process optimalisation steps

title.narrative: 1.3 - Number of context and organisational specific roadmaps developed to tackle identified obstacles to scale
2. Increased knowledge about cash programming information management (IM) and 121 products among DRA partners, their local partners and Red Cross Societies

description.narrative: 2 - Increased knowledge about cash programming information management (IM) and 121 products among DRA partners, their local partners and Red Cross Societies

title.narrative: 2 - Number of DRA members and local partners that report increased knowledge about cash programming information management (IM) and 121 products

comment.narrative: ZOA successfully participated in the different activities with various staff from different countries, resulting in increased knowledge about cash programming IM. Skills were used in implementation of a conditional cash project in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, using the 121 solution.

title.narrative: 2.1 Cash Information Management (IM) trainings organized
2.1 - Number of participants that complete the Cash Information Management training modules and positively rate the relevance for improving the quality of their cash programming

comment.narrative: 19 ZOA staff applied for the training, of which 7 staff completed the training and received a certificate.

title.narrative: 2.2. A 121 cash program design wizard is developed and validated to support humanitarian organizations in the design of emergency cash programs and choose the appropriate tools for implementation

description.narrative: 2.2 - A 121 cash program design wizard is developed and validated to support humanitarian organizations in the design of emergency cash programs and choose the appropriate tools for implementation

title.narrative: 2.2 - Number of DRA members, local partners and Red Cross Societies that contributed to and tested the Cash Program Design Wizard

comment.narrative: ZOA staff from Netherlands and Ethiopia offices contributed to the CPDW and tested the first draft.

title.narrative: 3. 121 products tested, adopted and integrated in the regular cash programming of DRA partners, their local partners and Red Cross Societies leading to safe, informed and accountable CVA experience for people affected that meets their needs

description.narrative: 3 - 121 products tested, adopted and integrated in the regular cash programming of DRA partners, their local partners and Red Cross Societies leading to safe, informed and accountable CVA experience for people affected that meets their needs

title.narrative: 3 - % of people affected that reports a safe, informed and accountable CVA experience that meets their needs based on the CaLP cash barometer

comment.narrative: This exact indicator was not fully measured, because available cash barometer questions were adjusted to the local context. 87% is the percentage of people who felt completely safe during the cash distribution.

title.narrative: 3.1 121 products contextualized for DRA partners, their local partners and Red Cross Societies and improvements made based on the technical roadmap

description.narrative: 3.1 - 121 products contextualized for DRA partners, their local partners and Red Cross Societies and improvements made based on the technical roadmap

title.narrative: 3.1 - Number of contextualizations and improvements made to the 121 products

comment.narrative: Contextualization for ZOA's conditional cash project in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia was successfully made. Platform was used by ZOA Ethiopia team.

title.narrative: 3.2 121 solutions and cash information management implemented to tackle identified challenges and barriers to scale

description.narrative: 3.2 - 121 solutions and cash information management implemented to tackle identified challenges and barriers to scale

title.narrative: 3.2 - Number of DRA partners, local partners and Red Cross Societies that have implemented 121 components and cash information management (IM) in their cash programming

comment.narrative: ZOA implemented 121 and cash IM components in Ethiopia.
